ActivityMetadata.Title: If Survey Branch Present in Request

Ingredients.Text: 1 pound ground beef 1 cup chopped onion 2 cups frozen corn, thawed 2 cups frozen peas, thawed 2 tablespoons ketchup 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce 2 teaspoons minced garlic 1 tablespoon cornstarch 1 teaspoon beef bouillon granules 1/2 cup cold water 1/2 cup sour cream 3-1/2 cups mashed potatoes (prepared with milk and butter) 3/4 cup shredded cheddar cheese

HtmlBodyPart.Html:
n a large skillet, cook beef and onion over medium heat until meat is no longer pink; drain. Stir in the corn, peas, ketchup, Worcestershire sauce and garlic. Reduce heat to medium-low; cover and cook for 5 minutes.

Combine the cornstarch, bouillon and water until well blended; stir into beef mixture. Bring to a boil over medium heat; cook and stir for 2 minutes or until thickened. Stir in sour cream and heat through (do not boil).

Spread mashed potatoes over the top; sprinkle with cheese. Cover and cook until potatoes are heated through and cheese is melted.

n a large skillet, cook beef and onion over medium heat until meat is no longer pink; drain. Stir in the corn, peas, ketchup, Worcestershire sauce and garlic. Reduce heat to medium-low; cover and cook for 5 minutes.

Combine the cornstarch, bouillon and water until well blended; stir into beef mixture. Bring to a boil over medium heat; cook and stir for 2 minutes or until thickened. Stir in sour cream and heat through (do not boil).

Spread mashed potatoes over the top; sprinkle with cheese. Cover and cook until potatoes are heated through and cheese is melted.

data.DisplayText: You are not eligible to apply
data.Author: admin

Header1.Text: You are not eligible to apply

Body1.Text: You've told us that your project is at the initial research stage

Body2.Text: The maximum grant available is X

Body3.Text: You may still be able to apply for funding from another source

TitlePart.Title: You are not eligible to apply

Header1.Text: Have you applied to this fund on more than two occasions for your proposed project?

AccordionDetails1.Text: If youve applied for an EEF grant for your technology once before but were unsuccessful, you may apply again. BEIS will not consider an application if the technology has already been submitted twice.

Header1.Text: Can you match at least 10% of your total project costs?

AccordionDetails1.Text: Applicants need private funding to cover at least 10% of the project's total cost. This could come from sources including, for example:

Header1.Text: Will at least 50% of this project's activities take place in the UK?

Accordion1.Text: How can I tell if my project will take place in the UK?

AccordionDetails1.Text: The United Kingdom includes England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland.

AccordionDetails2.Text: This does not include the Isle of Man and the Channel Islands. British overseas territories such as Gibraltar are also not included.

AccordionDetails3.Text: Activities may include, but are not limited, to:

Header1.Text: Do you have proof that your project is feasible?

Accordion1.Text: Do you have proof that your project is feasible?

AccordionDetails1.Text: Technology Readiness Level (TRL) is a way of judging the development of a innovation. BEIS uses this system in its assessment process. Your project must be at a minimum of TRL 3 (Proof of Concept) to get an EEF grant.

AccordionDetails2.Text: Projects which have reached TRL3 have proof of concept. This means that work has been done to prove that an idea can be made into reality.

AccordionDetails3.Text: To prove that your projects is feasible you should be able to show:

AccordionBullet1.Text: your project can be built or developed

AccordionBullet2.Text: results from testing for real-life application

AccordionDetails4.Text: To prove that your innovation is feasible you should be able to:

Header1.Text: Are you applying for funding up to and including 1 million?

AccordionDetails1.Text: Successful applicants can get up to 1 million from EEF, depending on their project. If you need extra funding for your project, it may come from another source, excluding other public funds. The project's total value must not be more than 2.5 million.

Header1.Text: You are not eligible to apply

Body1.Text: You've told us that more than 50% of the project's activities will take place outside of the UK

Body2.Text: To be eligible to apply more than 50% of the project's activities must take place within the United Kingdon.

Body3.Text: You may still be able to apply for funding from

data.DisplayText: Check if EEF is the right fund for you
data.Author: admin

Body1.Text: Use this tool to check if you are eligible to apply for funding before you start the application process.

Header1.Text: Check if EEF is the right fund for you

Body3.Text: Results are indicative only. You can return and start again at any time. Your answers will not be saved or used as part of your application if you wish to apply.

TitlePart.Title: Check if EEF is the right fund for you

Header1.Text: Does your project relate to one or more of the following:

AccordionDetails1.Text: The EEF welcomes applications from a broad range of carbon reduction technologies. Your proposal must address either the Governments 2050 Net Zero carbon targets or security of UK energy supply to be eligible.

Body1.Text: Please refer to the detailed guidance before starting your application. You can also review the application questions.

BulletA.Text: funding will not be available for any activities related to your project beyond March 2024

BulletB.Text: you can only apply for funding to cover project-related activities taking place from the grant's start date. Funding cannot be backdated to include any previous activities related to your project

govukheadingm.Text: The Energy Entrepreneurs Fund (EEF) supports innovative carbon-reduction technology through capital grants of up to 1 million.

GovMainInfo.Text: The Fund is open to UK organisations of any size, in both the public and private sector. It is particularly focused on helping small and medium-sized businesses, including start-ups.

GovMainInfo1.Text: Academic institutions are welcome to apply as part of a consortium, but can not be the sole applicant.

GovMainInfo2.Text: To be eligible for the grant, your proposal needs to address the Governments 2050 Net Zero carbon targets, or security of UK energy supply.

NavHeading1.Text: Check if EEF is the right fund for you

NavHeading2.Text: Download and read the application guide, questions and templates

NavHeading7.Text: Submit questions ahead of the applicant information presentation

TitlePart.Title: Q11 - Thank you for completing the  equality questions

ContentItems.DisplayText: Sex and gender identity
ContentItems.Author: admin

Question.Text: Is the gender you identify with the same as your sex registered at birth?

Body1.Text: Before you finish using the service, we'd like to ask you some equality questions. For more information on how we use your data, read our privacy notice.

Header2.Text: Do you want to answer the equality questions?

Body2.Text: These questions are optional. Public sector organisations have a duty to consider the need to avoid discrimination and advance equality of opportunity as part of what they do. This is part of what's called the public sector equlaity duty.

Body3.Text: Public sector bodies often collect equality information about service users to help meet this duty.

DetailsBody1.Text: More details on why we ask equality questions
